result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander L. Weihert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DOC Balance Inquiry
Transcript of August 19, 2016, Sentencing After Revocation Hearing
Insurance documents submitted by Attorney Rhiel at 8/19/16 hearing

Case called at 8:39am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Alexander L. Weihert in court with attorney John Vernon Rhiel.  Defendant Alexander L. Weihert in custody.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case history, status and filings. 
Recommendations presented by Counsel.  
Insurance documents submitted by Atty. Rhiel.
Statement presented by the Defendant. 
The Court orders a sentence of 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith and consecutive to any other sentence in being. 
--The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" and for the Substance Abuse Program.
--The Court gives 381 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no acts or threats of violence
--for the first six months after release from incarceration, Mr. Weihert is to have an in-person visit with the Agent at least two times per month, and then for next 6 months thereafter he is to have an in-person visit with the Agent at least once per month; thereafter the in -person meetings with the Agent are to be as designated by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational program
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--all outstanding financial obligations are to be reduced to civil judgments including
restitution of $135 to LA Tan, Watertown WI; $600 to Pawn America, Madison WI [related to read-in case #14CF201];10% restitution processing fees and costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge 
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess 9:21am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Order to disburse
Proposed Restitution Order
Attorney Svehlek
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[Clerk: MK]
cases #13CF429, #14CF201, #14CF231 called at 3:34pm.
Defendant Alexander L. Weihert in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
 
AS TO CASE #14CF231: 
Initial Appearance conducted:  Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Waiver of Prelim occurs:  Mr. Weihert waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment held:  Service of Information admitted, reading waived. ,maximum penalties recited
Plea Hearing held: Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Weihert guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF201.
--------------------------------------------
SENTENCING AS TO CASE #14CF231:
The Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Weihert on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail with work-release privileges for all purposes, to commence forthwith
--Mr. Weihert is required to serve the jail term without alcohol or non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no acts or threats of violence
--for the first six months after release from incarceration, Mr. Weihert is to have an in-person visit with the Agent at least two times per month, and then for next 6 months thereafter he is to have an in-person visit with the Agent at least once per month; thereafter the in -person meetings with the Agent are to be as designated by the Agent
--no contact with Kylie Minnameier, Daniel Otte, Stacy Otte, Samantha Otte, Meagan Montiel, Nicholas Ziegel
--to pay restitution of $600  to Pawn America, Madison WI [related to read-in case #14CF201]
--to pay resitution of $135 to LA Tan, Watertown WI 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fees
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational program
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court will not allow expungement of this record.
-----------------------------------------

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION AS TO CASE #13CF429:
On Count #1: the Court sentences Mr. Weihert to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes, to commence forthwith
On Count #2: the Court sentences Mr. Weihert to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes, to commence forthwith, concurrent with Ct. #1
On Count #3: the Court sentences Mr. Weihert to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes, concurrent to Counts #1 & #2
As to all three counts, Mr. Weihert is required to serve the jail term without alcohol or non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
Days credit for time already served:  58 days
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for unpaid financial obligations, the financial amounts now include the $200 DNA surcharge added as a financial obligation on each of the three counts.  The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.
recess 4:16pm.
